Module guigame
Package guigame.logic.menu

Class GameOverMenu

java.lang.Object
guigame.logic.menu.Menu
guigame.logic.menu.GameOverMenu
public class GameOverMenu
extends Menu
Logic for GUIGameOverMenu. Calculate a nice winner message.

Can either be constructed with parameters directly, or the parameters are set later before it is shown.

See Also:
GUIGameOverMenu

  • Constructor Details

    • GameOverMenu

      public GameOverMenu()
      Create a new GameOverMenu. setParams must be invoked before
      See Also:
      setParams(StartGameEventListener, Players, int), setWindow()

    • GameOverMenu

      public GameOverMenu​(StartGameEventListener l, Players players, int winner)

      Create a new GameOverMenu and set the parameters. Then show the window. The all-in-one solution for:

      GameOverMenu g = new GameOverMenu();

      g.setParams(l,p,w);

      g.setWindow();

      Parameters:
      l - The listener for start game events
      players - The players playing against each other
      winner - The winner's index (left = 0; right = 1)
      See Also:
      setParams(StartGameEventListener, Players, int)

  • Method Details

    • setParams

      public void setParams​(StartGameEventListener l, Players players, int winner)
      Set the params from here when the not-parametrized constructor was used.
      Parameters:
      l - listener to notify when a new game should be started
      players - the opponents
      winner - the index of the victorious player (0,1)

    • setWindow

      public void setWindow() throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Shows a new GUIGameOverWindow.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - If any param has not been set yet.
      See Also:
      setParams(StartGameEventListener, Players, int)

    • getWindow

      public javax.swing.JFrame getWindow() throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      Returns:
      the window the current GameOverWindow is shown on.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - If the window has not been set yet
      See Also:
      setWindow()

    • getWinnerMessage

      public java.lang.String getWinnerMessage()
      Format a String to show which player has won.
      Returns:
      a nice string to show which player has won
      See Also:
